summary: This bill, the Coordinated Federal Response to Extreme Heat Act of 2025, aims to reduce health risks associated with extreme heat. It establishes the National Integrated Heat Health Information System (NIHHIS) within NOAA and an interagency committee to coordinate a federal approach. The bill defines key terms like "extreme heat" and "heat event," outlines the committee's membership and responsibilities including developing a strategic plan and coordinating activities across agencies. It also details the purpose and data management of the NIHHIS and authorizes appropriations.
